ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In our family we really help and support each other.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we argue a lot. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we spend a lot of time doing things together at home.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we can talk openly in our home.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we are really mad at each other a lot. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we work hard at what we do in our home.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family there is a feeling of togetherness.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we sometimes tell each other about our personal problems.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we lose our tempers a lot. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we often put down each other. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: My family members really support each other.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: My family members sometimes are violent. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: I am proud to be a part of our family.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we really get along well with each other.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we begin discussions easily.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: In our family we raise our voices when we are mad. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: Brief Family Relationship Scale Cohesion Subscale
Notes: Sum of items: 1, 3, 6, 7, 12, 14, and 16

ElementDescription: Brief Family Relationship Scale Expressiveness Subscale
Notes: Sum of items: 4, 8, and 18

ElementDescription: Brief Family Relationship Scale Conflict Subscale
Notes: Sum of items: 2, 5, 9, 11, 13, and 19
